newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany's AMV sees no takeover in sight.
newsitem.headline: Germany's AMV sees no takeover in sight.

text.p: German insurer Aachener und Muenchener Versicherung AG (AMV) said on Wednesday that it knew of no potential buyers interested in taking over the group.

Management board chairman Elmo Freiherr von Schorlemer, responding to rumours that reinsurance group Munich Rueckversicherung was interested in buying AMV, told a news conference: "We are not aware of this and also do not believe this."
In recent months the AMV share price has risen strongly on the rumours. In bourse trade in Frankfurt on Wednesday the share was up 15 marks at 1,335 marks.

The group said earlier that it expected 1997 profits to be sufficient to allow an unchanged dividend pay-out this year and said profits had to increase if dividends were to be maintained and reserves strengthened.
